issue.description: product_view_definition is used as the product_view_definition for product_as_individual. So should either not constrain product_view_definition to be abstract or should make explicit sub types of product_view_definition for product_as_individual. e.g. product_as_individual_definition

The only available type of relationship for Product seems to be Alternate_product_relationship. Other types of product relationships need to be represented as well. A general Product_relationship seems to be missing. There is nothing like this on the subtypes either (e.g., there are no Breakdown_relationship and Part_relationship).

description.p: Is it by intention that no ..._view_definition or the like shall to point to the subtypes of Product_as_individual? Currently all the subtypes that are in the supertype-clause of Product_view_definition are redeclared in ways that do not allow references to Product_as_individual. Product_view_definition itself is abstract and can, thus, not be used. Are there subtypes of product_view_definition that are not in the ONEOF-clause that shall refer to Product_as_individual? Or shall, e.g., Product_as_individual always be instantiated together with another Product/Part_version and be linked using Product/Part_version_relationship?
Clarify the use of ..._view_definition with Product_as_individual subtypes. Probably, remove the ABSTRACT constraint on Product_view_definition.

comment.description: We did not create any explicit subtypes of product_view_defnition to use with the product_as_realized. Have removed ABSTRACT subtype constraint.

description.p: It is currently possible to represent numerical values with unit and string values. The representation of values without units, of booleans, logicals, and binaries seems to be missing. How should, e.g., a value of probability be described (in the ARM)? Add concepts or advice in the module on how other value types than numerical values with unit and string values shall be populated.

There is a requirement to specify which type of identification another identification system provides an alias for. Currently Alias_identification only points at the thing that is given an alias id, but does not relate to the other ids.
Either Alias_identification should get an optional link to an Identification_assignment, or Alias_identification.items can be assigned directly to an Identification_assignment.
Is it by intention that Product_as_realized and Product_as_planned are not valid select items for Effectivity_assignment.items ? Is effectivity meant only to be valid for design data, for example?
Add Product_as_realized and Product_as_planned to Effectivity_item.

There is a requirement to assign properties to the assignment of a person or organization to product data. That is, Organization_or_person_in_organization_assignment needs to be a valid select item for Assigned_property.described_element.

Example: A workshop is certified to perform maintenance work of a certain level in the context of one product. The property "capable of maintenance level" should be assigned to the relationship between the organization and the maintenance task, not to the organization. For another product or task the shop may be good for another level.
Add Organization_or_person_in_organization_assignment to Property_assignment_select.
It seems not possible to assign properties to conditions.
Add Condition to Property_assignment_select.
It is desirable to assign conditions to properties (a property which only is valid if a motor goes with 100 rpm).
Add Assigned_property to Condition_item.
It needs to be possible to assign a date to the event when a product is put into a slot. Product_in_slot needs to be a valid select item for Date_or_date_time_assignment.items .
Add Product_in_slot to Date_Or_Date_Time_Item.
There is a need to provide detail in a contract to say which classes of a reference data library are subject to a contract. Also the entire reference data library should become subject to a contract.
The same restriction seems to concern documents.
Add External_class and External_class_library to Contract_item and to Documented_element_select

The only available type of relationship for Product seems to be Alternate_product_relationship. Other types of product relationships need to be represented as well. A general Product_relationship seems to be missing. There is nothing like this on the subtypes either (e.g., there are no Breakdown_relationship and Part_relationship).
Include Product_relationship in 1292.

Applied_activity_method_assignment is not present in 1292 although Activity and Activity_method are present. There is a need to assign Activities etc. to product data. On the other hand, Activity is said to be out of scope.
Remove Activity related entity data types from 1292.
Activity etc. can not be classified.
Add Activity to Classification_item (or remove Activity - see previous comment).
Attributes of Physical_element_definition etc. can currently not be classified.
Add Breakdown_element_definition to Classified_attribute_select.
Attributes of Physical_element etc. can currently not be classified.
Add Breakdown_element to Classified_attribute_select.
Unit and attributes of Unit can not be classified. It seems, however, useful to classify the names of units, such as metre, and inch.
Add Unit to Classification_item and to Classified_attribute_select.
Attribute_classification and Classification_assignment can currently not be used for Effectivity_assignment.
Add Effectivity_assignment to Classification_item and to Classified_attribute_select.

A property (length, weight, ...) should be defined once to be available for reuse. Assigned_property does not seem to be suited for this purpose: it is to assign an individual value, but gives also a name to the property. Applied_independent_property seems to provide the concept of a reusable property type. On the other hand we were advised not to use it for this purpose. The definition of Independent_property is rather poor: "An Independent_property is a type of property. "
Provide in an introduction to the ARM or in an usage guide annex guidance on how to populate types of properties independent of their values.

It seems that Attribute_classification.classified_entity would better be of an aggregate data type (SET for example). Consider the name of a unit to be classified this way. With the current solution each instance of unit, the name of which is supposed to be in the class of unit names, requires an instance of Attribute_classification (each of which relates to the same Class). With an aggregate type attribute this proliferation of Attribute_classification instances would be avoided.
Change Attribute_classification.classified_entity to be an aggregate data type (SET).
Product is currently abstract. Part is for the design of a product. How shall an individual product be represented if there is no design information available?
One solution is to remove the abstract-constraint from Product.
Currently Events may only be assigned to two concepts: Certification and Project. May not "all" kinds of product data be subject to an Event?
Add to Event_item to allow an Event to be related to many product data types.
In the definitions of the attributes parent_/child_element the term 'functional element' should probably read 'zonal element'.
Replace in the definitions of Zone_element_usage.parent_/child_element 'functional element' by 'zonal element'.

The context for a selected_item is currently rather limited to Contract, Project, Product_Concept, and Part. It does, for example, not seem possible to use an individual product instance as context and, thus, to do configuration management without a design tree of the product. Breakdowns may not either be used as the context of configuration management.
Add Product_as_individual and Breakdown to Selected_item_context_items.

There is a need to assign a Dated_effectivity to the Effectivity_assignment of a Serial_effectivity to give a period of validity to the serial effectivity assignment. Currently the items select-type does not include Effectivity_assignment, but it should.
Add Effectivity_assignment to Effectivity_item.

Currently the concepts for linking to a RDL allow for storing the unique id of a RDL class in external_class.id. Should it not be possible to store the unique id of an element in the class as well, i.e., of the attribute value that Attribute_classification.items points to? For this Attribute_classification an attribute should be added to Attribute_classification, e.g., external_id.
The same applies to Classification_assignment; it should be possible to identify both class and member.
Add attributes to both Attribute_classification and Classification_assignment so that both identifiers of the owning class and the owned member can be assigned.

This entity data type seems to be intended for representing parts lists. However, the constraints on Component_upper_level_identification require for all members in the parts list that they are included in an assembly structure. There is a requirement that this entity data type not fulfils, i.e., to exchange parts lists without assembly structures. We propose to create another subtype to Assembly_component_relationship that can represent parts lists without attached assembly structures.
Create a subtype of Assembly_component_relationship that can represent parts lists without attached assembly structures.
It shall be possible to assign dates to State_transition.
Add State_transition to Date_or_date_time_item.
It should be possible to assign not only a start_id string to an effectivity, but also the instance directly. Start_id should be a select type.

Change Serial_effectivity.start_id and Serial_effectivity.end_id to select types that allow instances to be pointed at directly, not via comparing the strings of two identifiers - not knowing which identifier of the serialized item to choose.

What is the scope of the reference data when the data type of the attribue with the name Attribute_classification.name is an entity data type (and not a simple data type)? How much of the information that is related to the entity data type can the user expect to find in an external library (if such is used via External_class)?
The question applies similarly to Classification_assignment.
Clarify and provide guidance.

Both these entity data types have an attribute to specify one (or several) Units. To specify a single property value it is, thus, necessary to reference the same Unit twice. This may lead to errors (no rule seems to ensure consistency).
Ensure that there can not be any conflict between the units referenced by these two entity data types.
It should be possible to assign an identification to a Breakdown_element_usage.
Add Breakdown_element_usage to Identification_item.
It is necessary to assign Conditions to Assigned_properties to say under which conditions a property value is valid.
Add Assigned_property to condition_item.
